nodes.body: :v: Multramate can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7977822577/job/21781590887)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7977822577/job/21781591310)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7977822577/job/21781590491)

Thanks!

Please apply the suggestions and then feel free to merge.

bors d+

Surely this should be:
```suggestion
def evenOddStrongRec {p : ℕ → Prop} (n : ℕ)
```
after all:
```lean
example {p : Sort _}
    (peven : ∀ m : ℕ, (∀ k : ℕ, k < 2 * m → p) → p) : p :=
  peven 0 (fun k hk ↦ by simp at hk)
```

Yeah, this was basically my original definition (but with `Sort` rather than `Prop`):
```
noncomputable def evenOddStrongRec' {p : ℕ → Sort _} (n : ℕ)
    (peven : ∀ m : ℕ, (∀ k : ℕ, k < 2 * m → p k) → p (2 * m))
    (podd : ∀ m : ℕ, (∀ k : ℕ, k < 2 * m + 1 → p k) → p (2 * m + 1)) : p n :=
n.strong_rec_on <| fun m ih => m.even_or_odd'.choose_spec.by_cases
  (fun hm => by rw [hm] at ih ⊢; exact peven _ ih)
  (fun hm => by rw [hm] at ih ⊢; exact podd _ ih)
```
But with this I can't seem to make recursive definitions, which I can with the current definition:
```
noncomputable def foo : ℕ → ℕ :=
  fun n => evenOddStrongRec n
    (fun m => match m with
      | 0 => fun _ => sorry
      | n+1 => fun _ => sorry)
    (fun m => match m with
      | 0 => fun _ => sorry
      | n+1 => fun _ => sorry)
```
Interestingly, `Nat.strong_rec_on` isn't cased as `Nat.strongRecOn`?
I apologise if I'm being dense but I am still unable to understand why `evenOddStrongRec` is useful. Doesn't the `example` I provided above show that it's not really saying anything useful?
Yes, but my point is this was a hack so I can define my `foo`. I changed the definition but now I can't seem to prove `_even` nor `_odd`. Help wanted!
I'm not going to bother with `_even` and `_odd` because I can't prove them, but the definition is enough for me.

> I'm not going to bother with `_even` and `_odd` because I can't prove them, but the definition is enough for me.

Lean aside, it was never clear to me what the alternative meant. What you have now looks good though :-)

```suggestion
    (h_even : ∀ n : ℕ, (∀ k < 2 * n, P k) → P (2 * n))
    (h_odd : ∀ n : ℕ, (∀ k < 2 * n + 1, P k) → P (2 * n + 1)) : P n :=
```
I note that `Data.Nat.EvenOddRec` file is a leaf so changing this import is fine.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Data/Nat/EvenOddRec): add strong recursion principle on even and odd numbers
